intro: Rondeletia rufescens var. ovata, commonly known as the red-stemmed rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, with five petals, and are pollinated by birds and insects. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sun.
